text:
Question 165) During World War II, to decipher secret messages, the technique of decomposition into prime factors was used. A number N is given by the expression 2x ⋅ 5y ⋅ 7z, in which x, y and z are non -negative integers. It is known that n is a multiple of 10 and is not a multiple of 7.
The number of divisors of n, different from n, is
A) x ⋅ y ⋅ z
B) (x + 1) ⋅ (y + 1)
C) x ⋅ y ⋅ z - 1
D) (x + 1) ⋅ (y + 1) ⋅ z
E) (x + 1) ⋅ (y + 1) ⋅ (z + 1) - 1
